content: iris mitts pattern by rachael raimo pattern notes iris mitts the number one thing i always think in the winter is why didn t i bring gloves i always forget all about them and then i m left with cold hands so i designed these easy and beautiful fingerless gloves so that i ll never forget them at home again these gloves are gauge knit from the cuff up and feature a very simple cable repeat throughout 28 sts x 40 row = 4 square suggested yarn and needles knit in stockinette stitch in the round ~120 - 160 yards of fingering weight yarn sample knit with a superwash merino/nylon/cashmere blend for extra sizing softness on your hands small - 5 5 14 cm - 3mm us 2 5 needles 9 circulars or medium - 6 15 cm dpns for small circumference knitting or needles with a longer cord for magic loop large - 6 5 16 cm method additional materials to find your size measure the circumference of your wrist if you - yarn needle to weave in ends are between sizes or larger than -3 stitch markers the large size then size down -scissors -cable needle optional gloves will fit more securely with a snug fit and will stretch over time contact mavencrafted@gmail com @mavencrafted © maven crafted designs page 2 iris mitts pattern notes throughout the pattern you will see sizes indicated as s m l it is best to highlight your size so you know which stitch count to follow m1l stitch pick up bar from front to back between the stitch you just knit and the stitch you re about to knit knit through the back leg of the stitch 1 st increased m1r stitch pick up bar from back to front between the stitch you just knit and the stitch you re about to knit knit through the front leg of the stitch 1 st increased 1/1 right leaning cable slip one stitch onto a cable needle and hold in the back of your work knit the next stitch on your left needle then knit the stitch off your cable needle 1/1 left leaning cable slip one stitch onto a cable needle and hold in the front of your work knit the next stitch on your left needle then knit the stitch off your cable needle i highly recommend learning how to knit the 1/1 cables without a cable needle it will make knitting the cables a breeze page 3 © maven crafted designs iris mitts cuff left hand only cast on 45 48 51 sts with long tail cast on abbreviations method if knitting on long circular k - knit needles for magic loop method divide sts p - purl up evenly on both side of needles join in bor - beginning of round the round and place marker for bor co - cast on bobble - bind off round 1 - *k2 tbl p1* repeat to end tbl - through the back
